topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1 GA: Overview

section.p: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade (HCG) is a carrier grade OpenStack plus compute and network virtualization offering for NFV that enable CSPs to deploy network functions virtualization (NFV) applications on open source software platforms.

Some key examples include the host operating system (for example, Linux), server virtualization (KVM), network virtualization (vSwitch and SDN controllers), an installer and cloud lifecycle management framework, fault and performance management, and high-availability framework for the OpenStack control plane and the NFVI layer.

HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is based on HP Helion Openstack 1.1 but with significantly enhanced and optimized functionality, availability, scale and performance to meet the needs of NFV cloud deployments.
Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade includes following key components:

ul.li: OpenStack—core services including Horizon, Nova, Neutron, Cinder, Glance, Swift, Keystone, Ceilometer, and Heat. Other services will be added as needed in the future.

Compute node software package that includes:
Carrier-grade Linux (host operating system [OS] running on the compute nodes)
Carrier-grade KVM (for virtualization of the compute node)
Carrier-grade accelerated virtual switch (AVS), data plane development kit (DPDK)-enabled high-performance virtual switch
Management and middleware—composed of high-availability (HA) management; operations, administration, and maintenance (OAM); software image management; and fault and performance management
Guest software development kit (SDK) for inclusion in the guest OS of the VNF for performance acceleration and improving the HA framework above and beyond standard VIMs
HP Helion Lifecycle Manager (HLM)—cloud installer and lifecycle manager
Advanced self-healing
No single point of failure
Near-line rate networking throughout for VNFs like vEPC, vBRAS, vIMS, vFW, vRouter etc.
Bare metal compute performance
In-service upgrade capabilities
Enhanced security
Inventory management
Advanced resource scheduling and orchestration capabilities
NIC Bonding at the server level
HA for KVM instance
Compute Node failure detection and Auto-evacuation in kvm region
Live Migration in kvm region

section.title: Major Components in HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade
section.p: For installation and maintenance, HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade consists of two logical or conceptual regions: Non-KVM and KVM. See the Deployment Architecture diagram in the Technical Overview for an illustration of these two zones.

The Non-KVM region contains the HP Helion Lifecycle Management (HLM), to deploy and maintain HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade; and HP Helion OpenStack, a commercial-grade distribution of OpenStack. The Non-KVM region consists of a host system for HLM and three HP Helion OpenStack controllers.
For more information, see Non-KVM Environment Overview.

The KVM region is the heart of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. The KVM region consists of a software platform, providing ultra-reliability and exceptional performance efficiencies for telecommunications networks.
For more information, see KVM Environment Overview.

section.title: Foundation Care support
section.p: Foundation Care support for these products provides easy access to HP resources. With 24x7 service level, customers can submit cases to HP electronically through the HP Support Center portal or by calling HP directly.

ul.li: With 24x7 support, HP will respond to received cases within 2 hours. This coverage applies 24 hours per day, 365 days per year.

section.p: HP Helion OpenStack products as well as HP’s Helion CloudSystem solutions are supported by HP’s Cloud Center of Excellence, providing troubleshooting, advice and assistance. The Cloud CoE is a virtual team located around the world, available 24x7 (depending on the service level purchased). The Cloud CoE is highly trained in areas of OpenStack technology, virtualization, HP CloudSystem software, converged infrastructure, and complex solution interoperability. If a problem requires R&D resources, the CoE works directly with the product engineering teams as they investigate the issue.

In addition to the Foundation Care support bundled with HOS and DP products, HP offers a complete portfolio of support services, customer training and professional services. HP Datacenter Care is HP’s most customizable support service that can accommodate HP and multivendor equipment and software across a complete datacenter. Datacenter Care customers benefit from an assigned account team, faster response time and a rich set of proactive deliverables to ensure your environment is maintained for optimal performance.
HP Worldwide Customer Service contact numbers are available at:http://www.hp.com/country/us/en/wwcontact.html

section.b: HP Helion Professional Services for OpenStack Technology
section.p: HP has been helping customers deploy cloud and hybrid IT solutions for years and our HP Helion Professional Services have played a significant role in those successes. HP Helion OpenStack Professional Services is a dedicated team of professional services consultants available worldwide to accelerate and support OpenStack cloud capabilities and opportunities. These enterprise services are delivered by an experienced team of HP architects, cloud technologists, and engineers with expertise in design, storage, networking, security, database, scalability, high availability, and other OpenStack-based services.
Customers will benefit from HP’s Professional Services for OpenStack Technology in the following ways:

ul.li: Drive innovation and faster time to market/service delivery by enabling early adoption of OpenStack technology

Create new revenue opportunities by working with skilled OpenStack technology consulting experts to rapidly deploy OpenStack technology or create custom software as part of the cloud platform architecture
Mitigate risk by ensuring OpenStack technology-based projects are implemented with industry best practices and standard OpenStack processes and methodologies
Integrate development and operations by leveraging a best-practice implementation of HP Helion Development Platform, which sits on top of HP Helion OpenStack
Empower developers and operations to come together and easily enable building cloud apps leveraging highly scalable, highly available services with the HP Helion Development Platform
Achieve operational excellence by leveraging HP’s experience in managing and supporting IT environments
